commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant line numbers from code blocks
Update file names to be displayed in code block headings
Capitalise disk drive filepaths
Tweak seamless box style for headers (#1415)
Fix inline code in dark mode when printing (#1404)
Mention NODE_VERSION requirement in Netlify setup (#1409)
Add expand-headerless option to Panel component (#1417)
Extend variable data sources to .csv files (#1443)
Add fix for dropdown not showing in themes (#1451)
Add support for deploying to AppVeyor CI (#1453)
Update occurrences of --travis to --ci (#1458)
commitResults.messageBody:
Build scripts and userGuide are still using markbind deploy --travis.
As of PR #1453, this has been changed to markbind deploy --ci.

Let's update all occurrences of markbind deploy --travis.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support deploying via Github Actions using deploy --ci command (#1460)
commitResults.messageBody:
A Github Personal Access Token must be supplied as a
custom environmental variable in order to successfully deploy the
site via Travis CI and Appveyor.

For Github Actions, a default Github Token is
automatically generated for each Github Action job. The default Github
Token has sufficient write permissions to the repo, and so it
can be used in place of the Github Personal Access Token. To
incorporate the default Github Token, the deploy url has to use the
full url syntax of username:password.

Let's update the deploy url to use x-access-token as the username, as
per the official Github documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support deploying to gh-pages via CircleCI (#1471)
commitResults.messageBody:
As the markbind deploy --ci command would push a commit to the gh-pages
repo, it might unintentionally trigger a CI build.

Let's insert a [skip ci] directive into the commit message, which
instructs the CI services to ignore that commit and thus prevent it
from unintentionally triggering a CI build.

commitResults.messageTitle: Reorganize deploying the site page (#1489)
Add minor polishes to the userGuide (#1497)
Add support for PR previews using Surge (#1487)
commitResults.messageBody:
Netlify's deploy preview feature may not be suitable for certain
Markbind users due to its limited build minutes.

Expanding support for PR previews via Surge would cater to such
users due to its unlimited build minutes.

Let's add instructions in the userGuide for setting up PR
previews with Surge.

commitResults.messageTitle: NodeProcessor refactor: split into separate files (#1515)
Remove scroll-to-top button from print view (#1439)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is unlikely that users would want the scroll-to-top button to
be visible in the printed version of the website.

Let's enhance the scroll-to-top button feature by removing
it from the printed version.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rewrite panel transition for preview feature (#1430)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is not easy to implement the panel preview feature with the existing
transition code in our panels due to the use of v-show.

Let's rewrite some of the transition code and implement our own set
of transition code to allow for more flexibility. This will allow a cleaner
implementation of the panel preview feature.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement global disable intralink validation (#1428)
Implement peek feature for panels (#1425)
Implement Disqus plugin (#1449)
commitResults.messageBody:
Users may want to allow readers to comment on content in the website.
This can be an important feature for educational websites as it enables
better student interaction.

Let's integrate Disqus into MarkBind to enable this commenting feature.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix node-processing bug from dropdown temporary placeholder (#1467)
commitResults.messageBody:
Inserting the dropdown temporary placeholder before the dropdown itself
introduces a node processing bug, where nodes (e.g. panel) are not
processed properly after dropdown. Furthermore, it generates a lot of
duplicated dropdown temporary placeholders. This issue can be seen from
the test in test_site_algolia_expected.

Let's insert the dropdown temporary placeholder after the dropdown node
to circumvent this problem. Having it after the dropdown node will ensure
that the node processing is executed in a normal / fixed processing order.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix algolia selectors for no-indexing (#1468)
commitResults.messageBody:
The algolia selectors are not selecting the correct elements to insert
the algolia-no-index class to exclude the element from indexing.

Let's fix the algolia selectors by updating them to select the correct
elements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update deprecated Vue slot syntax (#1464)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our internal Vue slot syntax are deprecated according to official
Vue documentation. To ensure our codebase is up-to-date, let's
convert all the deprecated syntax to the latest Vue slot shorthand
syntax that was introduced in version 2.6.0.

We will still support the old slot syntax for backward compability,
by processing and converting the old slot syntax to the new
shorthand syntax.

Externally, users will be able to use the latest shorthand syntax for
slots as well, as our processing targets the latest shorthand syntax.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Markdown rules for bigger / smaller text (#1473)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no easy way for users to increase or decrease their text size.

Let's deprecate ++ for underline and use $$ to represent it instead.
In turn, let's use ++ to represent larger text and -- to represent
smaller text.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove shorthand slot syntax from documentation (#1483)
commitResults.messageBody:
Using # in attribute name is illegal according to the CommonMark
specification (v0.29). To comply with the specification, we should not
support the intended shorthand slot syntax.

Let's remove the shorthand slot syntax from our user guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update slot syntax for PageNavButton and SiteNavButton (#1484)
commitResults.messageBody:
PageNavButton and SiteNavButton are using deprecated Vue slot syntax.

Let's update the syntax to the latest Vue v2.6 shorthand slot syntax.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix escaped html characters in search result (#1501)
commitResults.messageBody:
Certain html characters are automatically escaped for
security reasons. However, it is not needed in our context
as the html is supplied by the user.

Let's prevent html characters from getting escaped so as
to render the html correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update header slots for Vue components (#1502)
commitResults.messageBody:
There aren't many benefits from having internal _header slots.
Furthermore, it is causing a minor bug in box header slot.

Let's convert them to just header for conciseness and to prevent
related bugs in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update intralink auto-conversion for links with URL fragment (#1493)
commitResults.messageBody:
The intralink auto-conversion function does not account for links which
have URL fragment.

Let's update it to convert links with URL fragment as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update underline syntax from $$ to !! (#1509)
commitResults.messageBody:
Using $$ syntax for underlining makes it harder for users to adopt
MarkBind for their existing documents, as some form of transformation
is needed for existing latex math using $$ delimiters.

Let's transition to using !! syntax for underlining instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix no-conversion syntax for intralink in user guide (#1494)
Compile Vue Page at build time to alleviate FOUC (#1512)
commitResults.messageBody:
Compiling each Vue page in the browser may be expensive as it is
possible for a page to get very large in size. This creates the problem
of flash-of-unstyled-content (FOUC) for the user which is unsightly
and may affect user experience. Although there are temporary styles
in place to tackle the problem, the FOUC problem largely remains.

Let's compile every Vue page during build time to alleviate FOUC.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change all $slots to $scopedSlots (#1535)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the update to the deprecated slot syntax in #1464, the $slots
syntax does not work as it used to anymore, possibly due to the
internal changes for slot syntax in Vue. To be specific, named slots
will always disappear from $slots upon re-rendering but will always
be present in $scopedSlots. This causes named slot content to
disappear from Vue components upon any re-rendering.

Let's change all $slots syntax to $scopedSlots to prevent slot contents
from disappearing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extend navbar highlighting to standard links and dropdowns (#1414)
Refactor Site.js to use async await (#1446)
Add sub-menu support for dropdown (#1455)
Enable linting for dropdown.vue (#1462)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, stylelint is only enabled for css files. Vue components may
also contain <style> tags with valid css but these are not linted.

Let's enable stylelint for .vue files as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix minor bugs in submenu (#1463)
Make css with header height reactive
commitResults.messageBody:
When header size is changed, the respective css
rules that depend on the height of the header
remain the same.

Let's modify the css rules to change according to
the size of the header.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement mobile site and page navigation menus
Implement fixed header toggling on scroll (#1474)
Eslint and stylelint all .vue files (#1482)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, most .vue files are ignored during the linting checks.

Since these files are frequently modified, we should validate
them in our ci tests to ensure they follow eslint rules. Furthermore,
.vue files can contain raw css, which may be run through stylelint.

Let's eslint and stylelint all .vue files so that they can be validated
as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Navbar.vue snapshot test (#1488)
commitResults.messageBody:
The brand content in the snapshot test is not
inserted correctly into the designated slot.

Let's fix this by shifting the brand content into the brand slot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support printing of all tabs (#1498)
commitResults.messageBody:
Tabs are supposed to contain alternative contents.
Readers can click on each tab to see its content. However,
when a page is printed or converted to PDF, the reader can
only see the content of the active tab.

Let's display all the tabs and its content when it is printed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove transition wrapper in Tab.vue (#1508)
commitResults.messageBody:
The transition wrapper is causing tabs to have "jumpy"
rendering when switching between them. Since tabs do
not have transition effect, we can remove the wrapper.

Let's remove the transition wrapper to fix the rendering issue.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix incorrect dropdown header color (#1511)
commitResults.messageBody:
Setting the color to inherit for all dropdown headers
will override the default color of button.scss. This css rule
is needed for dropdown headers in the navbar to have a
different color from the background.

Let's change this css rule to only target dropdowns in the
navbar instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement live preview for pages in site.json (#1514)
commitResults.messageBody:
When pages are added or removed from site.json, the respective
generated pages are not built or removed from the live preview.
Similarly, edited pages' attributes are not reflected as well. A server
reboot is necessary to display the new changes.

Let's support live preview for pages in site.json so that the user
does not have to restart the server each time page properties
are edited.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix intrasiteLinkValidation code block (#1527)
Fix missing return termination in rebuildRequiredPages (#1541)
UG: Remove Markdown styling on plaintext codeblocks (#1447)
Fix include panel processor tests (#1452)
Add omitFrontmatter attribute to include (#1448)
commitResults.messageBody:
Including a file combines the front matter of the file with the main
page. When authors wish to include the full content of the file but not
the front matter, they have to make their whole content a segment as a
work around, making the content less concise.

Let's add a new attribute to indicate whether the front matter data of
the included file should be omitted.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add animation to non-minimal panel open button (#1465)
Restyle minimal panel header to full opacity (#1469)
Code blocks: Support partial text highlighting (#1478)
commitResults.messageBody:
The code blocks line highlighting functionality only supports full-text
and full-line highlights. Authors who wish to only highlight certain
words or key variables are not able to do so with the supported syntax.

Let's add a new highlight syntax to provide authors with the ability to
partially highlight text in a line.

commitResults.messageTitle: Lazy serve: Track opened pages for dependency changes (#1513)
commitResults.messageBody:
The lazy serve option tracks only the last visited page for changes
in its dependencies. Users editing multiple files must manually
reload each page to keep the browser synchronized with the content.

Let's track the opened pages instead, and rebuild them when any of
its dependencies have changed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Lazy serve: fix untracked tab bug on backwards navigation (#1522)
Lazy serve: Fix improper handling of incomplete active urls (#1532)
Fix delay to return delayed function result for use (#1538)
